intro: Cecropia mocoana, commonly known as the Mocoan ceiba, is a large, fast-growing tree native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its buttressed roots and towering height, often reaching over 30 meters. The tree has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, arranged in clusters. It produces woody capsules that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. The plant is well adapted to disturbed soils and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks.
